title: Ticket #3543: Updating python-devel to python3-devel on fedora 17 build failure
description:
If the admin installs the python3-devel rpm on a machine, something happens wherein the builds fail because they include the 3.2 python headers.

Confirmed this by installing python3-devel on my fedora 17 laptop, and got the same errors as we are getting in NMI.

Admins will not be uninstalling the python3-devel package, as another user has requested it.
remarks:
2013-Mar-15 16:21:16 by bbockelm:
Is there possibly any way to get cmake to prefer the python-devel 2? Since the RPMs don't conflict, there must be some way to switch between them.

2013-Mar-15 17:40:40 by nwp:
That is essentially what the patch I pushed does. I just fixed it in the build glue to get things to run on the exec-111 host in NMI. It is a band-aid to move us along until someone who knows more than I has a real solution.

2013-Mar-15 17:43:08 by nwp:
Note that nmi run 109087 ran on exec-111, and the build was green, so that verifies the problem is fixed for the moment.

2013-Mar-25 14:13:27 by nwp:
Resolving this for now, as we have a workaround...
